          Executions in U.S. in 2016 Hit a 25-Year Low

          Georgia led the nation in executions this year, as the number of death sentences carried out in the United States fell to a 25-year low, according to capital-punishment researchers. States executed 20 inmates this year, eight fewer than last year's total and a fraction of the modern record of 98 set in 1999.
